alert.note: Alert for Central Oahu; East Honolulu; Kauai East; Kauai North; Kauai South; Koolau Leeward; Koolau Windward; Lanai Leeward; Lanai Mauka; Lanai South; Lanai Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Central Valley South; Maui Leeward West; Maui Windward West; Molokai Leeward South; Molokai North; Molokai Southeast; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Waianae Coast; Waianae Mountains; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 23 at 11:31PM HST until January 24 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY FOR NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS ON MAUI... .South to southwest winds will increase quickly to advisory levels tonight through Wednesday morning for areas over and north through east of the mountains, then continue through Wednesday afternoon as a cold front moves down the island chain. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South to southwest winds increasing to 20 to 30 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Kauai, Lanai, Molokai, Niihau, Oahu, and lower elevations of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
